shuffle.about: A totally wow random mix of questions from all categories and moods. Never know what's coming next—could be funny, deep, spicy, or thoughtful. Perfect for groups who want variety and spontaneity.
shuffle.format: Works for 2–15 people. Random draw from all question types. Keep everyone guessing, keep the energy high.

This or That.about: Quick, playful either/or questions that reveal preferences and personality in seconds. Perfect for breaking the ice and discovering what makes someone tick through simple but telling choices.
This or That.format: Ideal for 2–8 people. Easy, casual, low-stakes questions. No pressure, just fun conversation.

Light Questions.about: Warm, approachable questions that keep things friendly and comfortable. Great for getting to know someone without going too deep too fast.
Light Questions.format: Perfect for 2–10 people. Light topics, easy sharing. Safe space to open up at your own pace.

Moderate Questions.about: A step deeper than small talk. These questions invite meaningful stories, opinions, and experiences without getting too heavy.
Moderate Questions.format: Best for 2–8 people. Medium depth, thoughtful responses. Good balance between fun and substance.

In-depth Questions.about: For when you're ready to go beyond the surface. These questions explore values, life lessons, and deeper reflections that reveal who someone really is.
In-depth Questions.format: Works best with 2–6 people. Deeper topics, longer conversations. Create trust and real connection.

Love Couples.about: Designed specifically for couples to deepen intimacy, explore dreams together, and have those sweet or tough conversations that strengthen relationships.
Love Couples.format: Made for 2 people (couples). Intimate questions, honest sharing. Build closeness and understanding.

Parent Perspective.about: Questions from the parent's point of view—exploring parenting styles, values you'd pass down, and the joys and challenges of raising kids.
Parent Perspective.format: Great for 2–8 people. Parent-focused topics. Share wisdom, laugh at chaos, bond over the journey.

Child Perspective.about: Looking back at childhood memories, funny moments, and the unique lens of being a kid. Nostalgia meets playful storytelling.
Child Perspective.format: Perfect for 2–10 people. Childhood memories, silly stories. Relive the good old days together.

Sibling Perspective.about: All about sibling dynamics—inside jokes, epic fights, and the chaotic bond that only brothers and sisters understand.
Sibling Perspective.format: Best for 2–6 people. Sibling-specific stories. Laugh about the rivalry, celebrate the bond.

Grandparent Perspective.about: Honoring the wisdom, humor, and stories of grandparents. Questions that spark intergenerational connection and timeless advice.
Grandparent Perspective.format: Ideal for 2–8 people. Multigenerational sharing. Bridge the gap, treasure the stories.

This or That (Funny).about: Ridiculous either/or scenarios that make zero sense but spark huge laughs. Expect absurdity, expect chaos, expect fun.
This or That (Funny).format: Perfect for 2–12 people. Silly choices, loud reactions. Zero seriousness, maximum entertainment.

Bold Questions (Funny).about: Hilarious, slightly edgy questions that get people laughing out loud. Not offensive, just bold enough to keep things wild.
Bold Questions (Funny).format: Best for 2–10 people. Bold humor, funny confessions. Push the envelope, crack everyone up.

This or That (Spicy).about: Flirty, provocative either/or questions that turn up the heat. For adults ready to explore attraction, intimacy, and chemistry.
This or That (Spicy).format: Adults only, 2–8 people. Spicy topics, open minds. Flirt, tease, and test boundaries.

Bold Questions (Spicy).about: Unapologetically direct questions about sex, desire, and intimacy. For mature audiences who want raw, honest conversations.
Bold Questions (Spicy).format: Adults only, 2–6 people. Explicit content, no filter. Be honest, be bold, be respectful.

Values & Culture.about: Dive into workplace values, team culture, and what drives you professionally. Great for teams building trust and alignment.
Values & Culture.format: Perfect for 2–15 people. Work-focused values. Strengthen team culture, find common ground.

Challenges & Experiences.about: Real talk about professional challenges, growth moments, and lessons learned the hard way. Vulnerability meets career wisdom.
Challenges & Experiences.format: Best for 2–10 people. Work experiences, honest reflections. Learn from each other, grow together.

Never Have I Ever.about: The classic game of revealing what you've done (or haven't). Expect confessions, surprises, and a lot of 'Wait, really?!' moments.
Never Have I Ever.format: Great for 3–12 people. Take turns reading, raise hands if you've done it. Simple, addictive, revealing.

Debate Sparks.about: Hot-button topics and polarizing opinions designed to get people fired up (in a good way). Defend your take, hear the other side.
Debate Sparks.format: Best for 4–12 people. Pick a side, debate respectfully. Passionate discussion, open minds.

Would You Rather.about: Impossible choices that make you weigh tough trade-offs. Funny, philosophical, or downright brutal—every answer says something.
Would You Rather.format: Perfect for 2–10 people. Choose between two options, explain why. Quick rounds or deep discussions.

Truth or Dare.about: The timeless party game of revealing truths or taking on wild dares. Expect laughter, embarrassment, and unforgettable moments.
Truth or Dare.format: Best for 3–10 people. Pick Truth or Dare, complete the challenge. Keep it fun, keep it safe.
